text:
The following;
        <jar jarfile="myjar.jar">
          <fileset dir="c:/src">
            <include name="com/**/*.class"/>
            <include name="**/*.properties"/>
          </fileset>
        </jar>

Produces;
BUILD FAILED: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 
org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream.isSeekable()Z
creator: wgoldman@gr.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
This looks very odd, like a version problem. 

What is the output of 'ant -diagnostics'?

creator: wgoldman@gr.com
text:
I think it was a version issue. It is failing when I run it from
within Eclipse version 2.1.1. Which is locked to ant 1.5.3 (at least I have
found no way of overriding the version of ant eclipse uses to execute the
build, it appears you can specify a different version in the classpath, but
the version ran is locked at 1.5.3, I believe). When I run this from a
command window (dos nt 4.0) it works fine using ant 1.6.1. I do not have to
get this to work within Eclipse for anything beyond unit/development, so this
is an acceptable workaround.
Closing this since it really is version conflict.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
